innerData.title: Introduction to cricket
innerData.description:
Cricket is by far the most popular sport played. There is a lot of passion for cricket in India. Everyone loves to play cricket or watch cricket matches.

It is played with the help of a bat and a ball. There are two teams in cricket. There are eleven players on each team. The place where it is played is called pitch. In this, the batsman tries to take a run by hitting the ball with the bat. At the same time, the bowler wants him to dismiss him. A wicket, made of 3 wooden stumps and a pair of wooden bails, is set up on either end of the pitch and a crease is drawn 122 cms in front of the wickets. The field to the left of a right-handed batsman is called the leg side or on the side, and the field to their right is called the offside. A game consists of two innings separated by a break.

During the first innings, one team scores run by batting, while the other stops run from being scored and take wickets by bowling and fielding.

innerData.title: History of cricket
innerData.description:
The sport of cricket has a known history beginning in the late 16th century. Having originated in south-east England, it became the country's national sport in the 18th century and has developed globally in the 19th and 20th centuries. International matches have been played since 1844 and Test cricket began, retrospectively recognized, in 1877. 

Cricket is the world's second most popular spectator sport after association football. Governance is by the International Cricket Council (ICC) which has over one hundred countries and territories in membership although only twelve currently play Test cricket. Depending on the number of overs bowled by each team, there are several types of cricket, such as T-20 cricket (20 overs), ODIs (50 overs), Test cricket (unlimited overs).

Internationally, the ICC (International Cricket Council) regulates and regulates cricket. Apart from this, they have their own cricket boards for teams of different countries.

The BCCI (Board of Control for Cricket in India) India monitors this game. The game also hosts one-day Cricket World Cup competitions every 4 years and T-20 Cricket World Cup competitions every two years

innerData.title: What is a cricket
innerData.description: Cricket is a bat-and-ball game played between two teams of eleven players on a field at the center of which is a 22-yard pitch with a wicket at each end, each comprising two bails balanced on three stumps.

innerData.title: How is cricket played
innerData.description: Cricket is played with two teams of 11 players each. Each team takes turns batting and playing the field, as in baseball. In cricket, the batter is a batsman and the pitcher is a bowler. The bowler tries to knock down the bail of the wicket.

innerData.title: how was cricket invented
innerData.description: Cricket is believed to have been invented in South England. Some researchers claim that the game was played from as early as the 13th century. In the early days, cricket was played by children in the countryside. A stone was used in the place of a ball, and the players used a simple bat-shaped from a branch.

innerData.title: How was cricket originated
innerData.description: Cricket is believed to have begun possibly as early as the 13th century as a game in which country boys bowled at a tree stump or at the hurdle gate into a sheep pen. This gate consisted of two uprights and a crossbar resting on the slotted tops; the crossbar was called bail and the entire gate a wicket.

innerData.title: Derivation of the Name of cricket
innerData.description: The name may have been derived from the Middle Dutch Krick (-e), meaning a Timber or the Old English Cricc or Cryce meaning a crutch or staff, or the French word Criquet meaning a wooden post.

innerData.title: What is meant by T-20
innerData.description: T-20 is a new form of cricket which was started in 2003 in England. A newly-introduced variant of cricket from the general one-day matches, T20 cricket or Twenty20 cricket may be defined as a short cricket match limited to 20 overs of gameplay, lasting for about 80 minutes per innings, with a half-an-hour interval in between. The reason behind introducing this type of game was that cricket should first be made more exciting and more number of spectators participates in it. Although the method of this game is almost like other cricket disciplines, yet specific changes have been made in this game.

innerData.title: Runs and scores in cricket
innerData.description:
There are four ways in which batsmen score in cricket.

Fours- When a batsman hits the ball and the ball crosses the prescribed boundary, running on the field, then it is called fours.

Sixes- When the batsman hits the ball and it crosses the boundary without skipping in the air, then it is called six or 6.

Running between the Wickets- Pitches are made on the field with stumps on both sides and one batsman standing on both sides. The batting batsman hits the ball and both batsmen run towards the front stump to take a run.

Additional Runs- Also, due to the wrong ball of the bowler, the front team is given one run on each wrong ball

innerData.title: What is wicket in cricket
innerData.description: A wicket consists of three stumps, or stakes, each 28 inches (71.1 cm) high and of equal thickness (about 1.25 inches in diameter), stuck into the ground and so spaced that the ball cannot pass between them. In cricket, the term wicket has several meanings: It is one of the two sets of three stumps and two bails at either end of the pitch. The fielding team's players can hit the wicket with the ball in a number of ways to get a batsman out.

innerData.title: How large is cricket field
innerData.description: In the game of cricket, the cricket pitch consists of the central strip of the cricket field between the wickets. It is 22 yd (20.12 m) long (1 chain) and 10 ft (3.05 m) wide. The perimeter of the field is called the boundary and is sometimes painted or sometimes marked by a rope to mark the outer boundary of the field. The field can be round, square or oval, the most famous ground in cricket is the Oval. The surface is flat and is normally covered with extremely short grass, but can be completely dry or dusty soil with barely any grass or, in some circumstances, made from an artificial material.

innerData.title: Bet ball wicket and pitch length width

Cricket Wicket- Two sets of wickets shall be pitched opposite and parallel to each other in the centers of the bowling creases. Each set shall be 9 in/22.86 cm wide and shall consist of three wooden stumps with two wooden bails on top.

Cricket Pitch- The dimensions of a turf pitch are 20.12m long (from stump to stump) plus a minimum of 1.22m behind the stumps to accommodate the return crease and bowler approach area. The width of a turf pitch is 3.05m.

innerData.title: What is a cricket pitch
innerData.description: A cricket match is usually played between two teams of eleven players on an oval-shaped grass field. In the center of the field is a strip of hardened turf 22 yards (20.12 m) long and 305 cm wide with stumps on both sides of the pitch is called a cricket pitch. Two batsmen land on the pitch simultaneously, one of them on strike and the other on non-strike. The batting batsman hits the ball and both batsmen run towards the front stump to take a run.

innerData.title: How to become and umpire
innerData.description: Experimental and written tests are conducted from time to time by state-level sports boards to become umpires. If the person passes this examination then he is considered eligible to appear in the umpiring examination conducted by the BCCI. If the person passes this second level examination, he is selected for the BCCI panel and after umpiring in national matches for a few days, the person is given the opportunity to umpire in international matches. Then umpires are made in this way.

innerData.title: Rules of test cricket
innerData.description:
innings are played in a Test match, and each team bats twice and bowls twice. Before the start of play on the first day, the two team captains and the match referee toss a coin; the captain who wins the toss decides whether his team will bat or bowl first.

Test Cricket, this is the best format to test any player in cricket. It is played for a total of 5 days at the international level, which is played in three sessions every day and 90 overs are played in a day as standard. But it is not necessary to play only 90 overs a day.

innerData.title: How long is a test match day
innerData.description: A Test Match and first-class cricket matches are played over three to five days with, at least, six hours of cricket being played each day. List A matches last for six hours or more and twenty 20 and 100-ball matches lasting about three hours or less.

innerData.title: How many hours is the test match
innerData.description: In a five-day Test match, the game is usually played 6 hours a day in total. Test cricket is the form of the game of cricket with the longest match duration and is considered the highest standard of the game. Test matches are played between national representative teams that have been awarded and given Test status, as determined and awarded by the International Cricket Council.

innerData.title: How many overs do a test match
innerData.description: In Test matches, overs are not limited, yet 90 overs bowled are thrown in a day. However, two additional reviews are given by the ICC after 80 overs in Test innings. Players get a 40-minute lunchtime and 20-minute tea break in the afternoon. Test matches are typically played over 5 days. Four innings are normally played in a test match where each team bats and bowls twice.

innerData.title: Why does wicketkeeper wear gloves
innerData.description: Cricket is one of the popular sports. In a cricket bowling team, the wicket-keeper is a player who wears a helmet in the head, a pad in the feet, and great gloves in the hands. The gloves are worn to protect the hands during the match. Wicket-keeper's gloves have an anterior surface designed for catching the ball while offering protection to fingers and the palms of the hands from painful impact. Inside the glove, rubber thimbles are used to protect the fingertip from injury due to impact from the ball.

innerData.title: How many overs in an ODI
innerData.description: In the main, the Laws of cricket apply. However, in ODIs, each team bats for a fixed number of overs. One-Day International (ODI) is a style of cricket in which 50 overs are played per team between two national cricket teams. The Cricket World Cup is played according to this format.

innerData.title: Cricket interval between innings
innerData.description: There are special rules set out the duration of each interval. The interval between innings lasts for 10 minutes. In Test cricket, lunch will last for 40 minutes and tea for 20 minutes.

innerData.title: How many balls are in ODI
innerData.description: Two balls in play for ODIs and runners banned in all forms. A mini-revolution in cricket has been announced after the ICC announced two balls will be used by the fielding side from each end in one-day cricket. ODIs were played in white-colored kits with a red-colored ball.

innerData.title: How many power plays in an ODI innings
innerData.description: Each inning is divided into three power plays. As per the current rules, the power play consists of 15 overs in an innings. During this time, the power play is only 15 overs, which lasts for the first 15 overs. During this power play, three players are allowed outside the 30-yard circle.

innerData.title: How many unpires in an ODI match
innerData.description: In matches, there are 15 people on the field during the game. Out of these, there are 2 Umpires who control the movements that take place in the field.

innerData.title: Follow-on mean in a cricket
innerData.description: Follow-On is a term used in the sport of cricket to describe a situation where the team that bats second is forced to take its second batting innings immediately after its first because the team was not able to get close enough to the score achieved by the first team batting in the first innings.

innerData.title: Lunch and tea break time in test cricket
innerData.description: Food is taken care of for the players of both teams and there is a separate arrangement for food for both non-vegetarian and vegetarian players. During the Test match, players are given a lunch break after 30 overs. At the same time, after taking 30 overs after lunch, they are given a tea break, which is about half to 1 hour. While a lunch break in Test cricket lasts for 40 minutes, a tea break lasts for only 20 minutes.

innerData.title: Cricket is played in two innings
innerData.description:
Cricket is played in two innings, one team batting in each innings and the other team bowling and guarding the field.

The main objective of the team batting in the first innings is to score.

The main objective of the bowling team is to get the batsman out and score/run.

In front of the batting team in the second innings, there is a goal of run/score, which is given by the front team in the first innings, it has to be achieved.

The decision of which team will bat or bowl first is made by the captain of the team that wins the toss.

innerData.title: What is an LBW
innerData.description: Leg before wicket (LBW) is one of the ways in which a batsman can be dismissed in the sport of cricket. Following an appeal by the fielding side, the umpire may rule a batter out lbw if the ball would have struck the wicket, but was instead intercepted by any part of the batter's body (except the hand holding the bat).

innerData.title: General rules of test cricket
innerData.description:
The general rules of Test cricket are as follows-

Rule 27- In this, the fielders believe that if the batsman is out, then they can ask the umpire How is that?This is usually done by loudly shouting, raising both hands, before throwing the next ball. After that, the umpire decides whether the batsman is out or not.

Rule 28- There are many ways to get out when the wicket is dropped. This means that the ball is on the wicket, or the batsman or the hand in which the fielder is holding the ball is on the wicket and at least one Gilli has been dropped.

Rule 29- The batsman is out of his crease, the batsman can be run out or stumped out if he is out of his crease. The batsman is in his place, but if he or some part of his bat is on the ground behind the popping crease. If both the batsmen are in the middle of the pitch while the wicket is dropped, then it is called out.

innerData.title: Test cricket jersey
innerData.description: Test cricket is played mainly by wearing a white jersey (Clothes). When cricket started being played, only the white jersey was worn. Whether it is limited over cricket or test cricket. But the game changed with time and the jersey was separated in limited-overs cricket because of this, the team wears blue in India limited overs. At the same time, players' names were written on jerseys worn in Test cricket, which had never happened before in 150 years of cricket history.

innerData.title: What is T-20 cricket
innerData.description: Twenty 20 Cricket or T-20 is a shortened format of cricket. At the professional level, it was introduced by the England and Wales Cricket Board in 2003 for the inter-county competition. In a Twenty20 game, the two teams have a single innings each, which is restricted to a maximum of 20 overs. The reason behind introducing this type of game was that cricket should first be made more exciting and more number of spectators participates in it. Although almost the method of this game is similar to other cricket disciplines, specific changes have been made in this game.

innerData.title: T-20 cricket format
innerData.description: The format of the T20 match is the same as the format of any limited-overs match. The only difference is that it has just 20 overs, as compared to the one-day internationals or any other limited-overs game. There is also an interesting visible difference; the batsmen do not come from or go back to their dressing rooms during the match; instead, they have a row of chairs outside the field for that purpose.

innerData.title: T-20 cricket fielding
innerData.description:
For the first 6 overs in Twenty20 cricket, only two players will be out of 30 yards. The rest of the fielding lives inside the circle.

No more than 5 fielders can be kept on the leg side for a given period.

The fielding team will have to complete the entire 20 overs within 80 minutes. If not, the batting team may have to score extra runs.

If the batting team also wastes time, the Empire can take the same decision against them as well.

innerData.title: T-20 cricket in equality decision
innerData.description:
cricket, the game never ends on an equal basis unless there is a reason. As a super over, both teams have to play one over. You can also take it as a mini match.

If a team loses two wickets in this over, then that team will lose, or if it does not, then the team that scores the most runs will win.

If there is a tie in it, then the team which has the most sixes will get the victory, even if there is a tie in it, then the base team of fours will win.

innerData.title: Cricket bat length
innerData.description: According to cricket rule five, the length of a cricket bat cannot be more than 38 inches i.e. 97 cm. Apart from this, the gloves of the batter are considered to be part of the bat. In cricket, a new rule came into force that the blade of a cricket bat must be made of wood.

innerData.title: Cricket bat width
innerData.description: Generally, the right laws in bat play with the batsman, so choosing the right bat is very important. According to cricket rule five, the width of a cricket bat should be about 4.25 inches (10.8 cm).

innerData.title: Cricket bat depth
innerData.description: Laws saw no changes to the maximum length of the bat, which is still 38 inches/96.52 cm, but a new specification stated that the edge of the bat cannot be more than 1.56 inches / 4cm while the depth cannot be more than 2.64 inches / 6.7cm.

innerData.title: Cricket bat weight
innerData.description: Law 5 of the Laws of Cricket state that the length of the bat may be no more than 38 in (965 mm), the width no more than 4.25 in (108 mm), the overall depth no more than 2.64 in (67 mm) and edge no more than 1.56 in (40 mm). Bats typically weigh from 2 lb 7 oz to 3 lb (1.2 to 1.4 kg) though there is no standard.

innerData.title: Cricket bat size
innerData.description:
The blade of a cricket bat is a block of wood, usually flattened on the striking surface with a bulge on its back. It is a wooden bulge in the central part of the bat that the ball usually hits. The blade is attached to a long cylindrical cane, called a handle, similar to a tennis racket.

According to the rules, some limitations have been made regarding the size of the bat; the laws dictate that the length of a cricket bat may be no more than 38 inches (96.5cm) and the maximum width of the bat will be 108 mm, depth 67 mm and the edge 40 mm.

innerData.title: Cricket bat wood
innerData.description: The cricket bat is made from willow wood. Willow trees occur in the Aix region of England, in India it is the highest in Kashmir. The bat is traditionally made from willow wood, specifically from a variety of white willow called cricket bat willow. When the wood is cut to make the bat, it weighs ten kilos. But after seasoning, it remains just one kg 200 grams. The bat is then pressed with a special machine so that its playing part can be strengthened, the ball does not hit it and the ball can bounce. Applying linseed oil on the bat makes it even stronger.

innerData.title: Cricket bat wood types
innerData.description:
There are only 4 types of cricket bats for Players present in the world.

English Willow Cricket Bat- A cricket bat is a specialized piece of equipment used by batsmen in the sport of cricket to hit the ball, typically consisting of a cane handle attached to a flat-fronted willow-wood blade. The length of the bat may be no more than 38 inches (965 mm) and the width no more than 4.25 inches (108 mm). Its use is first mentioned in 1624. Since 1979, a rule change stipulated that bats can only be made from wood.

Kashmir Willow Cricket Bat- The willow used in making these bats was brought in by the British, who ruled India, during the 1820s. The wood used to make Kashmir willow bats is harder, and the weight of the bat is heavier in comparison to the English willow. The bats do not give the same performance as English willow and thus, are not as popular as them.

Popular Willow Cricket Bat- Poplar Willow for beginners of a cricket. They are called so because they are made from a Poplar tree.

Training Cricket Bats- Training cricket bats are specialized cricket equipment to improve and help you to practice your cricket skill. There is no particular piece of wood in the manufacturing of these cricket bats. Training cricket bats can be Kashmir willow or English willow, as cleared by the name training cricket bats, these cricket bats are used for the training purpose in the field of cricket.

innerData.title: Cricket fielding players
innerData.description:
The Cricket side is made up of 11 players, including a captain, a wicketkeeper, and several batsmen and bowlers.

The Captain- the most responsible position in the side. The captain usually has a say in the selection of the team. He or she is responsible for making the call at the toss of the coin before the start of the match. The captain also sets out the tactics by telling his fielders where to position themselves.

The Wicketkeeper- One of the biggest positions of responsibility. The wicketkeeper is responsible for retrieving the ball every time almost every time it is bowled unless it has been hit to another part of the field by the batter. He or she must be on their toes to take every ball that comes their way.

Bowlers- Bowlers are responsible for taking wickets by bowling the batter out. They must bowl consistently to prevent the batsmen from scoring easy runs. A bowler usually bowls six balls before the next bowler on his side has his turn from the other end of the cricket ground.

Batsmen or Batswomen- are responsible for scoring the runs when it is their turn to bat. They must seize upon the bad deliveries from bowlers and protect their stumps at all times.

innerData.title: It is very important to stay fit
innerData.description: First of all, it is very important to be fit. If you are not fit then you will not be able to perform well on the Cricket field. Always keep yourself healthy and fit.

innerData.title: Timing is vary important
innerData.description: While playing a cricket match, your timing should be absolutely accurate. A second hurry or delay can spoil your game. Therefore, it is necessary to have the correct timing while playing the shot.

innerData.title: Take regular training during sports
innerData.description: During the game, you should take regular training so that the body is fully prepared for the game. Warm-up and stretch before playing. Cool down and stretch after playing. Make sure that you remain fully hydrated. Drink plenty of water for this.

innerData.title: Perfect your grip on the bat
innerData.description: Place the bat on the ground with its end facing you. Pick up the bat by placing your dominant hand above your non-dominant hand. Put your thumbs in the opposite direction along with your fingers. Make sure you wear gloves for batting and place your thumb in V shape. Hold the bat according to your comfort.

innerData.title: Wear safety equipment white batting
innerData.description: Always wear safety equipment during training or cricket games. Such as gloves, leg pads, boxes, arm guards, etc. Also always wear a helmet while playing cricket.

innerData.title: Wear a helmet when batting in a cricket
innerData.description: Every time you play cricket, always put on a custom-fitted mouth guard. To protect the mouth and head, wear a helmet while batting or while keeping or fielding. Also, always wear gloves while batting, leg pads, box, arm guards, etc.

innerData.title: Keeps the ground safe while playing cricket
innerData.description: It is very important to keep the ground safe while playing cricket, so you remove the stones, etc. from the cricket field. Make sure that your pitch is clean during the match.

innerData.title: Holding the bat and standing properly
innerData.description:
Stand sideways to the bowler with your feet a shoulder-width apart.

Don't let your shoulders drop. Keep them as straight as you can as you're batting.

Stay on the balls of your feet while you're hitting.

Your eyes and shoulders should be level. Keep your eyes on the ball at all times.

innerData.title: Keep an eye on the ball
innerData.description: Always, eye on the ball. If you follow the ball till it pitches, you can figure out the position you have to take to hit the ball. As the ball comes towards you, think about which shot to hit. If the ball pitches at a sweet spot, you can drive to take long shots but if the ball pitches too high or low, take a defense shot.

innerData.title: Practice in front of your mirror
innerData.description: Practising your swing in front of a mirror before practising with a ball will make you perfect. This is known as shadow cricket. This will help you see your swing and help to make adjustments to your stance accordingly.

innerData.title: Bat at waist of height before swainging
innerData.description: Position your bat at waist height before swinging. Keep the bat pointed up or down and parallel to the ground. The exact position does not matter as you should be comfortable with your position and should be able to quickly move. Make sure that the flat surface of the bat is facing the bowler to make a good hit.

innerData.title: Practice work with the team
innerData.description: Make sure to always attend your practice sessions with your team. Drill work and playing with them makes you stronger and prepared for your big game. Always listen to your coach or team members if they give you any input on your batting.
